main event: A glowing blue-green fan-shaped object was observed on the horizon near Abilene, Texas, on January 1, 1948, lasting for 2 seconds and remaining stationary with no sound reported.
interesting points: The observation lasted for only 2 seconds, indicating a brief sighting.
The glow seemed to be fan shaped and originated from a large ball on the horizon, extending to the meridian due west of Abilene, Texas, in a perfectly clear sky.
No sound was heard during the sighting, suggesting silent movement of the object.
The green color of the object was said to be the only characteristic that might connect it with the 'New Mexico green fireballs', which was a notable feature.
The observer considered the possibility of the object being attributed to a disturbance of an electrical system or experiments at the White Sands Proving Grounds.
